name: NMN
primary_mechanism: NAD+ precursor; supports cellular energy and DNA repair
key_benefits: Supports healthy aging, mitochondrial function, and metabolic health
contraindications: Pregnancy, breastfeeding, active cancer (use with caution; limited data)
gender_modifiers: No major difference; consider higher dose in males with metabolic syndrome
age_modifiers: Higher priority and dose in adults >40

name: Urolithin A
primary_mechanism: Enhances mitophagy and mitochondrial biogenesis
key_benefits: Improves muscle endurance and mitochondrial efficiency
contraindications: Pregnancy, breastfeeding (limited safety data)
medication_interactions: None well established; theoretical interactions with CYP substrates
gender_modifiers: No major modifiers
age_modifiers: Higher priority in >40 with fatigue or sarcopenia risk

name: Resveratrol
primary_mechanism: Polyphenol; antioxidant; SIRT1 activation; anti-inflammatory
key_benefits: Supports vascular health, longevity pathways, and oxidative stress reduction
contraindications: Pregnancy; bleeding disorders
gender_modifiers: Use caution in hormone-sensitive cancers
age_modifiers: Higher priority >40 or with metabolic syndrome

name: Quercetin
primary_mechanism: Flavonoid antioxidant; mast cell stabilization; anti-inflammatory
key_benefits: Supports immune balance, histamine control, and oxidative stress reduction
contraindications: Pregnancy (high doses), significant renal impairment
medication_interactions: Possible interaction with fluoroquinolones and some CYP-metabolized drugs
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Higher usefulness in older adults with inflammation

name: Turmeric (Curcumin)
primary_mechanism: NF-κB modulation; anti-inflammatory and antioxidant
key_benefits: Supports joint comfort, inflammation regulation, and gut-liver health
contraindications: Active gallbladder disease, significant GERD at high doses, bleeding disorders
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: High priority in adults with chronic inflammation

name: CoQ10 (Ubiquinone/Ubiquinol)
primary_mechanism: Electron carrier in mitochondrial ETC; antioxidant
key_benefits: Supports cardiac function, exercise capacity, and cellular energy
contraindications: Rare: hypotension or GI upset at high doses
medication_interactions: May reduce warfarin effect; important adjunct with statins
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Higher priority in >40 and statin users

name: Fisetin
primary_mechanism: Flavonoid; senolytic activity; antioxidant
key_benefits: Supports cellular senescence clearance and oxidative stress reduction
dose_range: 100–500 mg/day or 1000–1500 mg/day in short pulses
timing: With meals; senolytic pulses often 2–3 days/month
contraindications: Liver disease, pregnancy, breastfeeding (limited data)
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Primarily >40, low priority in young adults

name: Luteolin
primary_mechanism: Flavonoid; antioxidant; neuroinflammation modulation
key_benefits: Supports cognitive function and neuroinflammatory balance
timing: With food, once or twice daily
contraindications: Pregnancy, breastfeeding (limited data)
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Higher priority in mid-life and older adults

name: Rutin
primary_mechanism: Flavonoid; capillary stabilizer; antioxidant
key_benefits: Supports vascular integrity and reduces oxidative stress
contraindications: Pregnancy, breastfeeding (high dose)
medication_interactions: Theoretical anticoagulant interactions at high dose
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Higher priority in varicose veins, venous insufficiency

name: Astaxanthin
primary_mechanism: Carotenoid antioxidant; membrane stabilization
key_benefits: Supports skin health, eye health, and oxidative stress resilience
contraindications: Shellfish allergy (check source), pregnancy (caution)
medication_interactions: Theoretical anticoagulant interaction at high doses
gender_modifiers: Higher cosmetic value in those with skin concerns
age_modifiers: Useful across adult lifespan; slightly higher priority with sun exposure

name: Essential Amino Acids (EAAs)
primary_mechanism: Provide essential amino acids for muscle protein synthesis
key_benefits: Supports muscle repair, lean mass gain, and recovery
timing: Pre-, intra-, or post-workout; or between meals
contraindications: Advanced renal failure; significant hepatic encephalopathy
medication_interactions: None major; separate from levodopa in Parkinson’s
gender_modifiers: Equally used; higher dose for heavier or high-volume trainers
age_modifiers: Higher value >40 to offset anabolic resistance

name: Branched-Chain Amino Acids (BCAAs)
primary_mechanism: Leucine, isoleucine, valine; trigger mTOR and reduce muscle breakdown
key_benefits: May reduce perceived fatigue and support recovery if dietary protein is low
contraindications: Advanced liver disease, maple syrup urine disease
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Less essential if total protein is optimal; higher value in low-protein diets

name: Creatine Monohydrate
primary_mechanism: Increases phosphocreatine stores; enhances ATP resynthesis
key_benefits: Improves strength, power, lean mass, and may support cognition
dose_range: Loading: 20 g/day (5 g x 4) for 5–7 days; maintenance: 3–5 g/day
timing: Any time daily, ideally with carbs or post-workout
contraindications: Advanced CKD, recurrent dehydration, active rhabdomyolysis
gender_modifiers: Great for both; may particularly support perimenopausal women in resistance training
age_modifiers: High priority in adults engaging in strength training

name: Whey Protein
primary_mechanism: Complete, rapidly absorbed protein; leucine-rich
key_benefits: Supports muscle gain, recovery, and satiety
contraindications: Severe dairy allergy; lactose intolerance (use isolate)
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Higher value in older adults and those with low dietary protein

name: Casein Protein
primary_mechanism: Slow-digesting protein; sustained amino acid release
key_benefits: Supports overnight recovery and muscle maintenance
contraindications: Dairy allergy; lactose intolerance (casein less problematic but still caution)
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Useful for older adults to prevent overnight catabolism

name: Mass Gainer Protein Blend
primary_mechanism: High-calorie blend of carbs, protein, and fats
key_benefits: Supports weight and muscle gain in underfed individuals
dose_range: 50–150 g powder/day depending on calorie needs
contraindications: Obesity, insulin resistance (use caution), lactose intolerance
medication_interactions: Similar spacing considerations as other protein powders
gender_modifiers: More common in hard-gaining males but can be used by anyone
age_modifiers: Not ideal for metabolic syndrome or older sedentary adults

name: Plant Protein (Pea-based, etc.)
primary_mechanism: Plant-derived protein; often lower leucine, slower absorption
key_benefits: Supports protein intake in dairy-free or vegan individuals
contraindications: Pea or legume allergy
medication_interactions: Same spacing as other protein sources for some meds
gender_modifiers: Useful across sexes; aligns with plant-based preference
age_modifiers: Similar to whey; adjust for kidney disease

name: Zinc
primary_mechanism: Cofactor in hormone synthesis, immunity, and enzyme function
key_benefits: Supports testosterone, immune defense, and skin health
contraindications: Copper deficiency risk with long-term high-dose use
medication_interactions: Separately time from quinolone and tetracycline antibiotics
gender_modifiers: Higher priority in men with low T, hair loss, or heavy training
age_modifiers: Moderate priority across adult ages

name: Magnesium Glycinate
primary_mechanism: Cofactor for >300 enzymes; nervous system calming; muscle relaxation
key_benefits: Supports sleep, stress resilience, blood pressure, and muscle recovery
timing: Evening or divided doses with meals
contraindications: Significant renal impairment
medication_interactions: Separate from certain antibiotics and bisphosphonates
gender_modifiers: High priority for women with PMS, perimenopause; also high for men under stress
age_modifiers: Very high priority in mid-life and older adults

name: Vitamin D3
primary_mechanism: Hormone-like vitamin; regulates calcium, immune, and endocrine function
key_benefits: Supports bone, mood, immune defense, and hormonal balance
contraindications: Hypercalcemia, granulomatous disease, severe CKD without supervision
medication_interactions: Caution with thiazide diuretics, digoxin (via calcium), some anticonvulsants
gender_modifiers: High priority for both sexes
age_modifiers: Critical for all adults, particularly >40 or low sun exposure

name: Vitamin K2 (MK-7)
primary_mechanism: Directs calcium to bone and away from arteries
key_benefits: Supports bone health and vascular calcification balance
timing: With fat-containing meals; often combined with Vitamin D
contraindications: Warfarin or vitamin K antagonist therapy
medication_interactions: Strong interaction with warfarin (avoid or monitor closely)
gender_modifiers: Very relevant in postmenopausal women; also important for men
age_modifiers: Priority rises with age and CVD risk

name: Ashwagandha
primary_mechanism: Adaptogen; modulates HPA axis and cortisol
key_benefits: Supports stress reduction, sleep, and testosterone in men
contraindications: Hyperthyroidism, autoimmune flares, pregnancy
gender_modifiers: Higher T benefit in men; useful for stress in all
age_modifiers: Use across ages; especially in high-stress adults

name: Methylated B-Complex
primary_mechanism: Supports methylation, energy metabolism, and neurotransmitter synthesis
key_benefits: Improves energy, mood, and homocysteine balance
dose_range: Per label; typically 1 capsule/day with B12 500–1000 mcg
contraindications: High-dose B6 neuropathy risk, stimulant-like effect in sensitive individuals
gender_modifiers: Useful across sexes; pregnancy requires specific prenatal formulations
age_modifiers: Higher priority in older adults with methylation issues or vegan diets

name: Pentadecanoic Acid (C15:0)
primary_mechanism: Odd-chain saturated fatty acid; AMPK activation; cell membrane stability
key_benefits: Supports metabolic health, inflammation balance, and cellular resilience
contraindications: None clearly established; caution in severe hyperlipidemia until more data
gender_modifiers: Useful across sexes
age_modifiers: Higher priority in mid-life metabolic syndrome

name: Folic Acid
primary_mechanism: Folate form; supports DNA synthesis and methylation
key_benefits: Crucial for neural tube development and cardiovascular methylation balance
contraindications: Untreated B12 deficiency (can mask anemia)
gender_modifiers: High priority for women of childbearing potential
age_modifiers: Less critical in postmenopausal women unless homocysteine is high

name: Omega-3 Fatty Acids (EPA/DHA)
primary_mechanism: Anti-inflammatory; membrane fluidity; pro-resolving lipid mediators
key_benefits: Supports heart, mood, cognition, joints, and hormone balance
contraindications: Bleeding disorders; fish allergy (use algae-based)
gender_modifiers: High value in menstrual and perimenopausal symptom support
age_modifiers: High priority across adult lifespan

name: Fiber (Soluble/Prebiotic Blend)
primary_mechanism: Improves stool bulk, slows glucose absorption, binds bile acids
key_benefits: Supports gut health, estrogen metabolism, satiety, and cholesterol
dose_range: 10–30 g/day from supplements in divided doses
contraindications: Severe GI narrowing, acute bowel obstruction
medication_interactions: May affect absorption of some meds if taken simultaneously
gender_modifiers: High value for women with estrogen dominance or PCOS
age_modifiers: Useful for all adults; titrate slowly in older adults

name: Probiotic Blend
primary_mechanism: Modulates gut microbiome composition and function
key_benefits: Supports digestion, bowel regularity, and immune balance
timing: With or without food per product, often daily for 8–12 weeks
contraindications: Severe immunosuppression, critical illness (caution)
medication_interactions: None major; caution with concurrent SIBO therapy strategies
gender_modifiers: Useful across sexes
age_modifiers: Use with caution in frail elderly and ICU patients

name: XOS (Xylooligosaccharide) Prebiotic Fiber
primary_mechanism: Selective prebiotic feeding beneficial gut bacteria
key_benefits: Supports microbiome diversity and short-chain fatty acid production
contraindications: Severe bloating, active SIBO (start very low or avoid)
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Use cautiously in very elderly with GI motility issues

name: Cranberry Extract
primary_mechanism: Proanthocyanidins prevent bacterial adhesion; microbiome modulation
key_benefits: Supports urinary tract health and may influence gut flora
contraindications: History of kidney stones (caution), salicylate sensitivity
gender_modifiers: Higher value in women with recurrent UTIs
age_modifiers: Useful across ages; caution with nephrolithiasis

name: Butyric Acid (Sodium Butyrate/Tributyrin)
primary_mechanism: Short-chain fatty acid; colonocyte fuel; anti-inflammatory in gut
key_benefits: Supports intestinal barrier integrity and reduces gut inflammation
contraindications: None strong; GI sensitivity at higher doses
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: High value in chronic gut symptoms

name: Vitamin E (Mixed Tocopherols/Tocotrienols)
primary_mechanism: Fat-soluble antioxidant
key_benefits: Supports cell membrane stability, skin health, and oxidative balance
contraindications: Bleeding disorders at high doses, vitamin K deficiency
gender_modifiers: Useful for skin and hormonal balance in both sexes
age_modifiers: Use moderate doses, especially in older adults with CVD risk

name: Berberine
primary_mechanism: AMPK activation; improves insulin sensitivity and lipid profile
key_benefits: Supports blood sugar balance and metabolic health
contraindications: Pregnancy, breastfeeding; neonatal jaundice risk (avoid in infants)
medication_interactions: Hypoglycemics, anticoagulants, some CYP and P-gp substrates
gender_modifiers: Useful in PCOS and metabolic syndrome in both sexes
age_modifiers: Higher priority in middle-aged with metabolic risk

name: Chromium (e.g., Picolinate)
primary_mechanism: Enhances insulin signaling
key_benefits: Supports glucose control and may reduce sugar cravings
contraindications: Significant renal impairment
gender_modifiers: Useful across sexes with insulin resistance
age_modifiers: More relevant in mid-life metabolic dysregulation

name: Glutamine
primary_mechanism: Conditionally essential amino acid; gut fuel; nitrogen donor
key_benefits: Supports gut barrier, recovery, and may affect cravings
timing: Empty stomach or between meals; post-workout
contraindications: Severe liver disease (ammonia concerns), seizure disorders (caution)
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Use with caution in older adults with hepatic impairment

name: Ginseng (Panax)
primary_mechanism: Adaptogen; modulates HPA axis; may influence glucose metabolism
key_benefits: Supports energy, resilience, and glycemic balance
contraindications: Uncontrolled hypertension, insomnia, pregnancy (caution)
gender_modifiers: May support erectile function in men; stress resilience in all
age_modifiers: Use broadly; caution in frail elderly with polypharmacy

name: Yerba Mate
primary_mechanism: Mild stimulant; catechins; may increase GLP-1 and fat oxidation
key_benefits: Supports alertness, appetite control, and metabolic rate
contraindications: Anxiety, insomnia, arrhythmia, uncontrolled hypertension, GERD
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Avoid in older adults with cardiac arrhythmias

name: BodyBio PC (Phosphatidylcholine Complex)
primary_mechanism: Provides phospholipids for cell membrane repair
key_benefits: Supports membrane integrity, liver function, and cognition
contraindications: Soy allergy (if soy-derived)
gender_modifiers: Useful in both sexes for detox and brain health
age_modifiers: Higher priority in mid-life onward or toxin exposures

name: BodyBio Balance Oil
primary_mechanism: Specific omega-6:omega-3 ratio to optimize membrane fluidity
key_benefits: Supports inflammation modulation and cell signaling
contraindications: Bleeding disorders at high doses; fat malabsorption
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Useful across adults; adjust for lipid profiles

name: Evening Primrose Oil
primary_mechanism: Gamma-linolenic acid (GLA) source; modulates eicosanoid pathways
key_benefits: Supports hormonal balance, skin health, and inflammation regulation
contraindications: History of seizures; bleeding disorders (high doses)
gender_modifiers: Particularly useful for PMS and perimenopausal women
age_modifiers: Use especially in reproductive and perimenopausal years

name: BodyBio ReMineralize
primary_mechanism: Electrolyte and trace mineral replenishment
key_benefits: Supports cellular hydration, enzyme function, and nervous system balance
contraindications: Severe renal impairment (monitor potassium, magnesium)
medication_interactions: ACE inhibitors, ARBs, potassium-sparing diuretics (if high K+)
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Adjust in older adults with CKD or heart failure

name: Quinton Isotonic
primary_mechanism: Seawater-derived mineral solution; supports extracellular milieu
key_benefits: Supports mineral balance and hydration
timing: Away from large meals or as directed
contraindications: Severe sodium-sensitive hypertension, heart failure
gender_modifiers: None specific
age_modifiers: Caution in elderly with volume-sensitive conditions

name: Mito Pro (ALA + ALC + NAC + Resveratrol + Micronutrients blend)
primary_mechanism: Supports mitochondrial function, antioxidant defenses, and glutathione
key_benefits: Improves cellular energy, detox pathways, and oxidative resilience
contraindications: ALA caution in thiamine deficiency; NAC caution in active ulcers or nitroglycerin use
medication_interactions: NAC with nitroglycerin (hypotension/headache); ALA may affect thyroid meds and chelation status
gender_modifiers: Useful across sexes
age_modifiers: Higher priority in >40 or high oxidative stress loads

name: Iron (oral)
primary_mechanism: Cofactor for hemoglobin and mitochondrial enzymes
key_benefits: Corrects iron deficiency anemia and supports oxygen transport
timing: Empty stomach if tolerated or with vitamin C; away from calcium
contraindications: Hemochromatosis, repeated transfusions, active infection (caution)
medication_interactions: Reduces absorption of levothyroxine, some antibiotics (space doses)
gender_modifiers: Generally avoid in men unless deficiency proven; high priority in menstruating women
age_modifiers: Use carefully in older adults; always lab-guided

name: Garlic Extract (Aged)
primary_mechanism: Modulates nitric oxide, platelet function, and lipids
key_benefits: Supports blood pressure and vascular health
contraindications: Bleeding disorders, upcoming surgery
gender_modifiers: Useful across sexes with CVD risk
age_modifiers: Higher priority with rising BP and age

name: Cocoa Flavanols
primary_mechanism: Vasodilatory and antioxidant effects via endothelial NO pathways
key_benefits: Supports blood pressure, vascular function, and possibly mortality reduction
timing: Morning or afternoon with or without food
contraindications: Caffeine sensitivity, reflux (if cocoa-based), kidney stones (oxalate caution)
medication_interactions: Theoretical with MAO inhibitors (tyramine in chocolate products)
gender_modifiers: Useful across sexes
age_modifiers: Higher priority in mid-life and older adults with CVD risk

name: L-Theanine
primary_mechanism: Increases alpha brain waves; modulates glutamate and GABA
key_benefits: Promotes relaxation without sedation; improves sleep quality
timing: Evening or pre-sleep; can also be daytime for anxiety
contraindications: Very few; hypotension (caution)
gender_modifiers: Useful across sexes
age_modifiers: Safe across adults; adjust for polypharmacy

name: Rhodiola Rosea
primary_mechanism: Adaptogen; modulates stress response and monoamine levels
key_benefits: Supports resilience, focus, and reduced stress-related fatigue
contraindications: Bipolar disorder (may precipitate hypomania), pregnancy
gender_modifiers: Useful across sexes under high stress load
age_modifiers: Caution in older adults with polypharmacy and mood instability

name: Saffron Extract
primary_mechanism: Modulates serotonin and other neurotransmitters; anti-inflammatory
key_benefits: Supports mood, PMS symptoms, and anxiety
contraindications: Pregnancy (high doses associated with uterine stimulation)
medication_interactions: Antidepressants (theoretical serotonin syndrome risk at high doses)
gender_modifiers: High value for women with PMS or mood swings
age_modifiers: Use broadly in adults; caution in complex psych conditions

name: Hydrolyzed Collagen
primary_mechanism: Provides amino acids for collagen synthesis
key_benefits: Supports skin elasticity, joint comfort, and nail strength
timing: Any time; often morning or in smoothies
contraindications: Allergy to source (bovine/marine)
gender_modifiers: High aesthetic value in women; joint value in both
age_modifiers: Higher priority >30 with skin/joint concerns

name: Hyaluronic Acid (Oral)
primary_mechanism: Hydrophilic polysaccharide; improves tissue hydration
key_benefits: Supports skin moisture and joint lubrication
contraindications: Very few known; allergy to source
gender_modifiers: Higher aesthetic demand in women; joint benefit in both
age_modifiers: More relevant in mid-life and older adults

name: Black Seed Oil (Nigella sativa)
primary_mechanism: Thymoquinone-mediated anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects
key_benefits: Supports scalp, skin, and metabolic parameters
contraindications: Hypotension (caution); pregnancy (limited data)
medication_interactions: Hypoglycemic and antihypertensive meds (additive effects possible)
gender_modifiers: Useful across sexes for hair and metabolic health
age_modifiers: Adjust dose in older adults with polypharmacy

name: Saw Palmetto
primary_mechanism: 5-alpha-reductase inhibition; androgen modulation
key_benefits: Supports prostate health and may reduce androgenic hair loss
contraindications: Pregnancy, breastfeeding; hormone-sensitive cancers (caution)
gender_modifiers: Primarily for men; women only if not trying to conceive and well counseled
age_modifiers: High priority in men with BPH or androgenic alopecia

name: Biotin
primary_mechanism: Cofactor for carboxylase enzymes; keratin infrastructure support
key_benefits: Supports nail strength and hair quality in deficiency
contraindications: Can interfere with lab assays (thyroid, troponin, etc.)
gender_modifiers: Used widely in women for cosmetic benefit
age_modifiers: Labs must be interpreted with biotin interference in mind at any age
